summary: The term "electorate" refers to the body of individuals eligible to vote in elections, a fundamental concept within the electoral procedure and voting category of EU legal and regulatory frameworks. In the context of the European Union, the electorate encompasses citizens of member states who possess the right to participate in democratic processes, including the election of Members of the European Parliament (MEPs). The legal provisions governing the electorate are crucial for ensuring fair representation and adherence to democratic principles. Consequently, the electorate plays a pivotal role in shaping EU legislation and policy through its voting power, thereby influencing the governance of the Union.
